intro: Gypsophila pulvinaris, commonly known as the snowball gypsophila, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers that resemble snowballs, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a compact, bushy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its delicate flowers bloom in late summer, adding a charming, airy effect to the landscape.
